alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 8:08AM HST until July 19 at 12:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 AM HST, rain gages and the North Kohala radar indicated that rainfall continues over the windward slopes of the Big Island. Although rainfall rates have eased over the past couple of hours, water levels in the stream and river gages along the windward slopes remain high but have been lowering. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Waikoloa Village, Kapaau, Honokaa, Pohakuloa Camp, Pohakuloa Training Area, Laupahoehoe, Honomu, Ninole, Papaikou, Ookala, Pepeekeo, Hakalau, Paauilo, Volcano, Glenwood, Mountain View and Keaau. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1115 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. A Flood Watch remains in effect through this afternoon for Hawaii County.
